oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Home of Gustavus Henry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front view of the Gustavus Henry home, "Emerald Hills" (also known as Eagle's Nest). The home has columns, two dormers, a chimney, a balcony, decorative cornice, and an ornate pediment. Transom windows flank the entrance door. A fence encloses the front porch.

Originally named Eagle's Nest, the house was built in 1830 in the Greek Revival architectural style for owner Thomas W. Frazer. In the 1840's, Frazer donated the home to Marion McClure (his niece) who was the wife of Confederate States Senator Gustavus Adolphus Henry Sr.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dwellings--Tennessee; Architecture, Domestic--Tennessee; Greek revival (Architecture)
